isobxr 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Using isobxr

Compose a stable isotope box model scenario

Source: R/run_composite_model.R
compose_isobxr.Rd

A function to compose an isobxr box model scenario, defined by a series of n model runs inheriting from previous run's final state and with the possibility to force conditions at each run, namely:

  1. fluxes (all or overwriting only a subset of them)

  2. isotope fractionation coefficients (all or overwriting only a subset of them)

  3. box sizes

  4. rayleigh distillation

  5. isotope composition of a source box

  6. (...)

compose_isobxr(
  workdir,
  SERIES_ID,
  time_units,
  COMPO_MASTER,
  plot_HIDE_BOXES_delta,
  plot_HIDE_BOXES_size
)

Arguments

workdir

Working directory in which the general master file (0_ISOBXR_MASTER.xlsx) and composite master file (e.g., 0_COMPO_MASTER.xlsx) are found and where the output files will be stored.
(string of characters).
SERIES_ID

Name of the composite model series the run belongs to, that will determine the folder in which the output files of this composite run will be stored. A composite run number will be automatically linked to it and no run will overwrite a previous composite run.
(string of characters).
time_units

Vector defining the initial time units (identical to time unit used for fluxes) followed by the time unit used for the graphic output.
(vector of two strings of characters, eg. c("days", "years")).
COMPO_MASTER

Name of the composite master file (e.g., 0_COMPO_MASTER.xlsx), defining the composite run scenario.
(string of characters).
plot_HIDE_BOXES_delta

Vector of strings of characters defining the names of the boxes to hide in the plot of the delta values as a function of time edited as a pdf.
(e.g., c("BOX_A", "BOX_C"))
plot_HIDE_BOXES_size

Vector of strings of characters defining the names of the boxes to hide in the plot of the box sizes (masses of X) as a function of time edited as a pdf.
(e.g., c("BOX_A", "BOX_C"))

Value

If non existing, the fonction creates and stores all outputs in a dedicated composite SERIES directory located in working directory.
Directory name structure: 3_CPS + SERIES_ID + YYY, where YYY is an automically set composite run number between 001 and 999.
No overwriting of previous composite runs is possible.

  1. Creates the set of inputs and outputs for each successive n runs, numbered from to 1 to n in an XXXX format (see run_isobxr documentation).
    Named with the following format: CPS + SERIES_ID + YYY + XXXX

  2. Archives the composite master file.
    (file name structure: 0_CPS + SERIES_ID + YYY + COMPO_MASTER.xlsx)

  3. Archives the local LOG for the given composite run.
    (file name structure: 0_CPS + SERIES_ID + YYY + LOG.csv)

  4. Stores the evolution of delta values with time in all boxes over the n runs that constitute the composite run scenario.
    (file name structure: 0_CPS + SERIES_ID + YYY + evD.csv)

  5. Stores the evolution of box sizes (masses of X) with time in all boxes over the n runs that constitute the composite run scenario.
    (file name structure: 0_CPS + SERIES_ID + YYY + evS.csv)

  6. Edits the pdf of the all in one plot of the evolution of delta values + sizes in all non hidden boxes.
    (file name structure: 0_CPS + SERIES_ID + YYY + p_evDS.pdf)

  7. Edits the pdf of multiple plots of the evolution of delta values in all non hidden boxes.
    (file name structure: 0_CPS + SERIES_ID + YYY + pf_evD.pdf)

  8. Edits the pdf of multiple plots of the evolution of box sizes in all non hidden boxes.
    (file name structure: 0_CPS + SERIES_ID + YYY + pf_evS.pdf)

See also
